intro: Angostura resinosa, commonly known as the resinous angostura, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, resinous properties. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, and it has opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its resin has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a fragrance ingredient. Angostura resinosa is also valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
